caption: If you are tired of Pho, you have to try King of Thai Boat Noodles for that noodle soup experience at a whole different level. Don't get me wrong, I still love pho noodles, but it is kind of the same after a while. Thai boat noodles offer richer soup bases and more varieties of noodle choices to change it up from the simplicity of pho noodle soups.
super delicious! Love it! And people here are very friendly! We went here twice in a row, highly recommended.
Authentic Thai food that you have to try! Awesome service and very friendly staff. Right across from Walmart so we went there after shopping. Try them out! 🤙🏽🤙🏽
Wow! Wonderful food and 100% traditional Thai Dishes! The flavors were perfect and blended well. The best I've ever had and I highly recommend eating here if you're visiting O'hau or Honolulu!👍
The Thai food here was spectacular.  We ordered Pad Thai, Pineapple fried rice, and papaya salad.  It was better than the Thai food I’ve had in Thailand.  100% recommend!

Amazing place ! A true gold nugget we found,  Had a few different plates and all are 5 stars. Cindy was amazing and took great care of us . Well worth the stop and most importantly don't judge a book by its cover !
So happy I found this place! I’ve tried many Thai places on the island, but this one is by far the best. Taste just like home!
This place is LEGIT! Come here for authentic Thai. I’ll be back for more!
Fantastic food, excellent customer service. Highly recommend!!
Authentic Thai place. Very good food.
Delicious crab fried rice and pad se ew. I highly recommend this restaurant
Amazing food, quick service & Very friendly.
So surprise to find such authentic Thai restaurant in Hawaii.   The food is excellent and the service is great.   Would definitely come back again.
Best Pad Kau Paow I had on the island so far

Authentic Thai, hidden right across from WALMART next to subway off Ke'eamoku...parking available but limited seating around main meal times. Service was excellent, so nice and polite. Cook even came out cause we ordered special not on menu. Wanted a meal we eat in Thailand, they delivered...perfect
Authentic!! Really reminds me of the dishes I tried in Thailand, and I can't say the same for majority of the Thai restaurants abroad.
Great Thai food at this restaurant. Would for sure come back. Staff was very nice.
Excellent food! If you don't like spicy they have option for "no spice." I got level one and it had a slight kick. Online ordering available on their website.
Excellent Thai food. Well priced, well spiced, good portion sizes.
Amazing food and great service

If you are tired of Pho, you have to try King of Thai Boat Noodles for that noodle soup experience at a whole different level.  Don't get me wrong, I still love pho noodles, but it is kind of the same after a while. Thai boat noodles offer richer soup bases and more varieties of noodle choices to change it up from the simplicity of pho noodle soups.  The Combination Beef Noodle Soup offers a rich and spicy dark broth loaded with hearty chunks of different beef. It is truly filling and satisfying, so you won't be hungry for a while.  For something way different, there is the Yen Ta Fo Noodle Soup. It offers lots of seafood in a red bean based broth that is impossible to describe, but something you must try. I am not sure if it is for everyone and probably need to be in the mood for it, but very good all the same.  The Crab Meat Fried Rice is a great dish to share. It has lots of crab meat that has been perfectly fried with onions in the rice. Simple on the ingredients, which is perfect for highlighting the crab meat flavor that comes out.  Of course they make classic Thai Green Papaya Salad, which is made fresh to order. The balance of ingredients really makes this dish a perfect starter or side with you order.  The place is very clean and well lighted. Service was friendly and fast. Over all value of their dish prices was very good and well worth it.  This review was written after my second visit and I plan to go again for sure, so yes, I do recommend trying it.

I am Thai and I am happy to say King of Thai Boat Noodles serves up authentic Thai food. From the delicious warm chewy flaky roti and curry dip appetizer to the variety of noodle dishes, you will get authentic non westernized Thai flavors. Ask what the weekend specials are, you won't be disappointed and will get the real deal . Several unique menu items. We had khanom jeen on a Sunday, (somen noodles w spicy aromatic curry n veggies) and pig's feet stew on Saturday. Delicious! Plenty of parking on the street or at Wal-Mart or Ross.
Foods taste pretty good especially the Thai Boat Noodles. Close to what you can get in Thailand. Staff is very friendly. Don't forget to ask for the daily special menu!
Friendly waitress, perfect clean white tables, delicious food. Fried dumplings were amazing. New restaurant must try!
